result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William J Lekander

records.addlTxt: ADA Andrea Raymond appeared for the State. Attorney Kara M. Rolf appeared in person with Defn. STC scheduled, NIH.
Status conference on December 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on November 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

2:37 PM Defendant William J Lekander in court.  Attorney Richard Jones for Kara M Rolf in court for William J Lekander.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: Continue to monitor
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 02:20 pm.

01:53 PM Defendant appeared.  Rebekah M Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has applied for SPD, but no one is appointed yet.  Case rescheduled.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

03:07 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Crystal A Vera.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
